info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Abbeville, or near Hodges, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Due West, Lake Secession, Hodges, Shoals Junction, Donalds and Antreville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
